009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.line;
010
011import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
012import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
014
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.line.AlgebraicLine;
018import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
019
020public class OrthogonalLineFitSvd implements LineFit {
021        
022        private final int n;
023        private final double[] p;       // line parameters A,B,C
024        
025        public OrthogonalLineFitSvd(Pnt2d[] points) {
026                if (points.length < 2) {
027                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("line fit requires at least 2 points");
028                }
029                this.n = points.length;
030                this.p = fit(points);
031        }
032        
033        @Override
034        public int getSize() {
035                return n;
036        }
037
038        @Override
039        public double[] getLineParameters() {
040                return p;
041        }
042        
043        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] points) {
044                final int n = points.length;
045                final double[][] X = new double[n][2];
046                Pnt2d ctr = PntUtils.centroid(points);
047                final double xc = ctr.getX();
048                final double yc = ctr.getY();
049                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
050                        X[i][0] = points[i].getX() - xc;
051                        X[i][1] = points[i].getY() - yc;
052                }
053                
054                SingularValueDecomposition svd =  
055                                new SingularValueDecomposition(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(X));
056                
057                RealMatrix V = svd.getV();
058                double[] s = svd.getSingularValues();
059                int k = Matrix.idxMin(s);
060                double[] e = V.getColumn(k);
061
062                double A = e[0];
063                double B = e[1];
064                double C = -A * xc - B * yc;
065                return new double[] {A,B,C};
066        }
067        
068        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
069        
070//      static double[][] X = {{ 10, 6 }, { 4, 3 }, { 18, 2 }, { 7, 1 }, { 5, 6 }};
071//      static double[][] X = {{ 10, 6 }, { 4, 3 }};
072//      static double[][] X = {{ 1, 1 }, { 3, 3 },  { 13, 13 }};
073        static double[][] X = {{1, 8}, {4, 5}, {4, 7}, {6, 4}, {9, 4}}; // book example
074        
075        public static void main(String[] args) {
076                Pnt2d[] pts = PntUtils.fromDoubleArray(X);
077                LineFit fit = new OrthogonalLineFitSvd(pts);
078                System.out.println(fit.getClass());
079                AlgebraicLine line = fit.getLine();
080                System.out.println("line = " + line);
081                System.out.println("avg error = " + fit.getSquaredOrthogonalError(pts) / X.length);
082        }
083        
084//      class Fitting_Lines.lib.OrthogonalLineFitSvd
085//      line = AlgebraicLine <a=0.497, b=0.868, c=-7.245>
086//      avg error = 0.5329166870097324
087        
088}
